The video was published on Twitter on Ju: 2020, which aligns with the claim that it shows flames on the India-China border in June 2020.
The video features the logo for Douyin: the Chinese version of video-sharing app TikTok, indicating its origin.
Throughout the footage: a person can be heard speaking Mandarin, further suggesting its connection to China.
The video: s caption, translated from simplified Chinese to English, mentions the China-India border and refers to media silence and soldiers fighting with stones, providing context to the content of the video.
